decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the provisions of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no extensions (including porches or dormer windows) to the dwelling houses or buildings shall be erected within the curtilage.Reason: To safeguard the privacy and amenity of adjoining occupiers, maintain adequate amenity space and safeguard the cohesive appearance of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings (other than those hereby approved) shall be formed in the south-western elevation at first floor level or above, of the building hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The facing materials used in the development to which this permission relates shall be those approved under application reference 20/00710/CLC.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence has been submitted to and approved in writing by the council confirming that the development has achieved not less than a 19% reduction in CO2 emissions compared to Part L of the Building Regulations 2013 and internal water usage rates of no more than 105L per person per day.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out and thereafter retained in strict accordance with the landscaping scheme approved under application reference 20/00710/COND.The approved scheme shall be implemented within the first planting season following completion of the development and the tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only.Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out and thereafter retained in accordance with the details and tree protection methodology set out within the Arboricultural Impact Assessment & Method Statement dated 23 August 2019. The protection scheme shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work associated with the proposed orangery and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: In the interests of visual amenities and so that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The garage and car parking accommodation shown upon the approved drawings shall be provided with a hard bound dust free surface, adequately drained before the development to which it relates is occupied and thereafter it shall be kept free from obstruction at all times for use by the occupier of the development and shall not thereafter be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of the development and visitors to it.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking accommodation and to avoid the congestion of surrounding roads by parked vehicles in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out and thereafter retained in strict accordance with the refuse storage and recycling facilities approved under 19/00489/COND. These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

All works on site shall take place in strict accordance with the details approved under 19/00489/COND regarding:(a) Provision for loading/unloading materials.(b) Storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles.(c) Temporary site access.(d) Signing system for works traffic.(e) Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arising from development works.(f) Location of all ancillary site buildings.(g) Measures to protect any tree, shrubbery and other landscape features to be retained on the site during the course of development.(h) Means of enclosure of the site.(i) Wheel washing equipment.(j) The parking of vehicles of the site operatives and visitors(k) The erection and maintenance of security hoarding.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out and thereafter retained in strict accordance with the details of the implementation, adoption, maintenance and management of a sustainable drainage system approved under 21/00030/CLC.Reason: These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with Policy CS1 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out and thereafter retained in strict accordance with the details of the fences, walls or other means of enclosure proposed to be erected along the boundaries of the site which were approved under 19/00489/COND.Reason: In order to ensure the privacy of adjoining occupiers and visual amenity of the area is retained in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out and thereafter retained in strict accordance with the details of secure and covered cycle parking facilities which were approved under 19/00489/COND. These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Before any occupation of the development hereby approved, the windows in the South West elevation and situated on the first floor of the building hereby permitted, shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing of a patterned type only which shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, details of a privacy screen along the south east (side) elevation of the proposed terrace shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The approved boundary treatment shall be installed prior to the beneficial occupation of the development and thereafter retained. Reason: To safeguard the privacy of neighbouring No. 11, details of a privacy screen along the south east elevation of the terrace are required to demonstrate that there would be no unacceptable loss of privacy as a result of the proposed terrace, in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
